intro: Baccaurea suvrae, commonly known as the Sunda mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically round and have a thick, colorful rind. These berries are often consumed fresh or used in traditional medicine due to their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a valuable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
